data.title: John Ford
data.meta_description: John Martin "Jack" Feeney, or Sean Aloysius O'Feeney was an Irish-American film director most famously known as John Ford. data.text:
John Martin "Jack" Feeney, or Sean Aloysius O'Feeney was an Irish-American film director most famously known as John Ford.

Biography[]

In 1920, John Ford directed Six Steps to Hell, a film on which Indiana Jones worked to help pay for his studies at the University of Chicago.

→ This article is a stub. You can help us by . Check out the talk page for hints on what needs to be done.

Behind the scenes[]

Stephen Caffrey portrayed John Ford in Young Indiana Jones and the Hollywood Follies.

Towards the later years of his life, John Ford wore eyeglasses over an eyepatch, similar to Old Indy (George Hall).

Appearances[]

The Young Indiana Jones Chronicles – "Young Indiana Jones and the Hollywood Follies" → Hollywood Follies
